topic.title: Tumblr bans porn
topic.body:
As of December 17th, Tumblr will start censoring the site according to new community guidelines, which prohibit “images, videos, or GIFs that show real-life human genitals or female-presenting nipples.” Female-presenting nipples! Can we get over boobs already. The policy allows for some rare exceptions: “Certain types of artistic, educational, newsworthy, or political content featuring nudity are fine.”

The rationale for the decision is unclear, despite a lengthy blog post from CEO Jeff D’Onofrio on the subject. It seems vaguely to do with protecting people from the porns, even though the site already makes it fairly difficult to find the porns. This decision follows Tumblr’s recent removal from the Apple iOS App Store over a failure to fully filter out **child pornography**.

So rather than fix the problem, they just removed everything for everyone. -.-

topic.title: Breaking from Iframe
topic.body: some sites I visit say this message and I want to know what it means.

1543928148_1E5pgBaKNzFU9Loeg7eDGrSkXqJAq.body:
> [schiz0](#comment_28_153dW34Ng5fVUZ5D5NcZRfAbvRQS1jYC1k): Evviva! [...]

I hope so, I have been using this for a fee days now and it's very nice. Much easier to find content than over tor.

> [psybin](#comment_5_1FEureQqgUD5PLLxvaMWajQUzfzRAwJ4UE): So what happens when a MTF/FTM trans shows their boobs on there?..

on here nothing, there is no one to enforce any rules.You can pub;ish what ever you like.

> [timelinehyperbot](#comment_81_12JYCt1Mj1Fa7GA9N67HAxP6NiBHVWK9GS): Due to stupid people posting CP on Tumblr they were FORCED to ban adult content.

thats not true, there is a national database of child porn images that you can train AI's on to detect it. This plus manually reviews and reports would have been enough.

Not only that they could have worked with authority's  to catch the uploads.

> [timelinehyperbot](#comment_82_12JYCt1Mj1Fa7GA9N67HAxP6NiBHVWK9GS): Yea... that is true but they stated CP that is not on that special police data base was being displayed on Tumblr.

which is the whole point of using the AI to look for images LIKE CP, plus adding support staff to handle reports when they come in but instead they just ruined it for everyone.

> [lacapo](#comment_16_1Nv1anNtKATNc9NQwBEXqSFTtwXTf6o6xX): Tumblr isnt dead already ? XD

no, it had a rather large adult content community, it was the only thing going for it.

> [xianc78](#comment_28_141zS75MupoDVjN4p7ivG9pXUXjAm9jLBQ): Yes, but I don't think most Tumblr users would be tech-savvy enough to use them and I bet once they realize that ZeroNet is uncensored, they will call us an "alt-right platform" or something like that.

that is exactly what will happen, the same thing happened to gab because that guy went on a killing spree even though Facebook, twitter and other have all had their fair share of extreme people using their platform.

I was thinking of created a website that would act as a proxy that would remove the barrier completely, basically you go to a website and get access to zeronet.

> [xianc78](#comment_29_141zS75MupoDVjN4p7ivG9pXUXjAm9jLBQ): There are many sites that do that already. ZeroWiki has a list here. What we really need is to have major browser to have ZeroNet built in. Firefox is the most likely since they have natively supported the gopher protocol for the longest time and there have been talks about implementing IPFS. I'm sure that if ZeroNet gets popular enough, they may implement it as well or instead of IPFS.

didn't know thanks for the link :P though I do like running it on my machine.

1544254269_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2.body:
> [robione](#comment_96_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): The idea is to use a command or a few that will reliably get you the external IP of the machine which you can connect to for services and used in management. It cannot be a custom script, it must be something available on any system by default. [...]

I always use 

curl 'https://api.ipify.org?format=json'

retrurns json like this

{"ip":"123.123.123.123"}

> [robione](#comment_98_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): Here's a bad example with a good outcome: [...]

this returns nothing on my machine.

> [robione](#comment_99_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): that is why it is a bad example.take off the last command and see what the result is. if nothing, keep going.

it actually fails at | grep 32 | :/

1543348094_16VrCKQQiVZpJ6S5xJASR8LCFLv24.body:
> [tusiko](#comment_17_1G2W1r5Eh1M81v8sUanDq2Cj4xnaRJurgs): The shared data in Freenet is fully encrypted and so you can always say that you never know, what you share. In my eyes ZeroNet is a very good thing, but I would prefer some encryption. Perhaps encrypted peer data and json content.

Seeing as you only share sites you visit and after seeing such content you can just block and remove.

Plus for the encryption to work everyone would have to know the encryption key to verify the published content is valid and as every would have the key the point of encrypting it is very quickly lost and all you are left with is a slower network for everyone.

1544706846_1GHXQ3vMtadfHFjTwS3roqYe8LUsy.body:

having the all reasons as "nope" is a pretty poor way to maintain a list, also, not providing the link to verify it should be blocked is also not ok.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_551_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): @hypercode yes, you can not prevent it thus you have to:1) encrypt your zeronet data folder as suggested (Veracrypt works on Windows and Linux)2) use proxy to connect internet to hide your real IPA) VPN server from reliable "no logging" VPN provider or setup own VPN serverB) in zeronet.conf or in /Config enable tor Always mode and run Zeronet in Tor Browser (it is also on ZeroUp) [...]

thanks for the config, if you use tor always why does it not set the trackers proxy to also use tor?

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_552_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): I think that it is because the tracker connections do not carry and private/sensitive information. When using proxy (especialy Tor), the data have to travel longer route via more computers which is making connection slower (maybe even a few hundred miliseconds?)

but couldn't a person create a tractor and then use that to monitor a network and that this IP asked for this site? could be used to prove you were looking at illegal content?

1545026098_1b4WB9mZcpjKdQUnYvGBgTMeatTxX.body: launching zero net with --open_browser "browser here" will change it. if you do it with just "" it doesn't open in a browser which is much better and should be the default.

1545042706_1b4WB9mZcpjKdQUnYvGBgTMeatTxX.body: You could always create a script to download all the pages and serve them but wouldn't it be better to get the service to move here?

1545029431_1b4WB9mZcpjKdQUnYvGBgTMeatTxX.body:

Zeronet is open source and there are a lot of active developers I would assume security bug would be found and fix on github.

1545106555_1NPaMdmTDg441cn76DGdUjz5ZXeVT.body:

This is not true PHP is not required to take form data, using this website is a perfect example of how user input can be taken without any server side processing.

This form I am typing in is no different to any other form that you could create.

> [n4n0](#comment_3_1Q3jT2vtT4gYV1rZqAvDrRzEPeXH9S7T6M): Yeah I played around with site creation on ZeroNet a bit and it's pretty straightforward; create whatever you want in vue or react or simple bootstrap html, then webpack it and you're done. Need to read up on how data is distributed among zn-clients, and how to minimize storage impact.This is really fun stuff!

it really is :) though my free time is been taken up with machine learning, there is a package called brain.js that you can use in the browser to create neural networks. actually simple and fun.

I don't understand any of the math.

1546939398_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUt.body:
it's using the bittorrent protocal AKA perr to perr downloading.

tracker keep a list of seeds and when you go to a new site it asks the trackers and you download from them.
